profile.name: Austin Klein
profile.biography: I am currently a Rochester Institute of Technology undergraduate student working on my BS in Software Engineering. I expect to graduate after the spring of 2017. I have completed two co-op blocks where I worked full 40 hour work weeks developing and testing software for a company. I am now finishing my third co-op, and by the time I graduate I will have nearly a full year of experience in the field. While I am a full stack developer, lately I have been working mostly on the front-end.

careers.title: EagleDream Technologies
careers.description: During my second co-op I worked on a number of software projects, at times from conception to completion. We were in charge of testing our own deliverables in order to assure they fit the requirements. I was also able to work with a number of different technologies many of which were new to me.

careers.title: Soleo Communications
careers.description: My first co-op while attending RIT allowed me to own the entire quality assurance process and quality of the product. I developed Selenium test scripts and automated testing plans as well as participated in design reviews and planning meetings. This gave me a chance to learn what the 'real world' of Software Engineering was like and cement my interest in the field.

careers.title: Crellin Park
careers.description: While working here I would arrange a safe and fun environment for kids to play and learn through games and programs. Once I became a head counselor I oversaw junior counselor's activities to ensure a proper work ethic. We provided diverse activities from kickball to arts and crafts to swimming, to produce a well-rounded experience.

careers.title: Jiminy Peak Mountain Resort
careers.description: I got my first job as soon as I turned 14 and was legally allowed to work. Here I learned how to communicate effectively with individuals, whether three years-old or adults. I taught children from the ages of three to twelve, and skill levels from beginner to expert, during a five hour lesson on how to ski.

educations.title: Rochester Institute of Technology
educations.description: This university offered a fantastic co-op program which helped me get over a year of full time experience at a few different companies before I even graduated. While attending RIT I was part of the Varsity Crew for a few years, took classes in a range of subjects, and was able to figure out what I wanted to get out of a full-time job.

educations.title: Chatham Highschool
educations.description: During highschool I was an active member of the Varisty Tennis and Varisty Cross Country teams. I also enjoyed music and played multiple instruments while being a part of both the concert and marching bands. I took two computer science classes which gave me my first taste of the field.

technical_skills.title: Java, Javascript, HTML, CSS, C#, Python,

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.description: This personal website was created to document my growth in the professional world. It was created using AngularJS, Bootstrap, CSS, and HTML. A JSON file stores most of the personal details which allows for easy updating and easy reuse of the code for other users.

projects.title: Tool Share
projects.description: A community tool sharing website built using Python, Bootstrap, and the Django web framework. Completed for a class while attending RIT.

projects.title: Chat Project
projects.description: I updated most of the pages facing the public while on my second co-op at EagleDream. The main functionality was completed by another employee. This site is also using AngularJS and Bootstrap.

projects.title: Skyscraper
projects.description: This is a fun little backtracking solver for the Skyscraper puzzle done in one of my first semesters at RIT. It was written in Python.
